-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | a FFI utility
--   
--   errno is a small utility to supplement the FFI. Many C functions will
--   return a special Int if an error has occurred, and the withErrno*
--   functions allow you to lift them into the ErrorT String transformer. I
--   found this in some cases useful for when I wanted to handle errors
--   from both C &amp; Haskell on equal footing.
@package errno
@version 0.1

module Foreign.C.Error.Errno
withErrno :: (Integral a, MonadIO m) => m a -> ErrorT String m a
withErrnoPred :: (Integral a, MonadIO m) => (a -> Bool) -> m a -> ErrorT String m a
